entities.name: stone
entities.description: The Stone refers to the Philosopher's Stone, which has been destroyed. It is described as something that can grant 'as much money and life as you could want'.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is a young person who seems amazed by the idea of death being like going to bed. He is addressed directly in the conversation.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is an older person who has had a chat with Nicolas Flamel and agrees that it's all for the best. He sounds delighted when Harry mentions knowing about Nicolas.

entities.name: nicolas flamel
entities.description: Nicolas Flamel is a friend of Dumbledore's who has had a chat with him about the Stone. He and his wife will die soon.

entities.name: perenelle
entities.description: Perenelle is Nicolas Flamel's wife who will also die soon.

relationships.description: Dumbledore and Nicolas Flamel had a chat about the Stone, and they agreed it's all for the best.
Harry knew about the Stone, which has been destroyed.
Dumbledore mentions that Nicolas and Perenelle will die soon.
Nicolas Flamel is related to the Stone, as he has had a chat with Dumbledore about it.
